TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit AL extends Microsoft.Build.Tasks.ToolTaskExtension

Docs.summary: Implements the AL task. Use the AL element in your project file to create and execute this task. For usage and parameter information, see AL (Assembly Linker) Task.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

.method familyorassemblyhidebysig virtual instance void AddResponseFileCommands(class Microsoft.Build.Tasks.CommandLineBuilderExtension commandLine) cil managed
Protected Friend Overrides Sub AddResponseFileCommands (commandLine As CommandLineBuilderExtension)

Docs.param: Command line builder to add arguments to.
Docs.summary: Fills the specified parameter with switches and other information that can go into a response file.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ AlgorithmId { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.AlgorithmId : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an algorithm to hash all files in a multifile assembly except the file that contains the assembly manifest.
Docs.value: The algorithm to hash all files in a multifile assembly except the file that contains the assembly manifest.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information, see the documentation for the `/algid` option in [Al.exe (Assembly Linker)](/dotnet/framework/tools/al-exe-assembly-linker).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ BaseAddress { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.BaseAddress : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the address at which a DLL will be loaded on the user's computer at run time.
Docs.value: The address at which a DLL will be loaded on the user's computer at run time.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Applications load faster if you specify the base address of the DLLs, rather than letting the operating system relocate the DLLs in the process space. This property corresponds to the /base[address] option in [Al.exe (Assembly Linker)](/dotnet/framework/tools/al-exe-assembly-linker).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool DelaySign { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.DelaySign : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether to place only the public key in the assembly () or to fully sign the assembly ().
Docs.value: if only the public key is placed in the assembly; if the assembly is fully signed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information, see the documentation for the `/delay[sign]` option in [Al.exe (Assembly Linker)](/dotnet/framework/tools/al-exe-assembly-linker).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Description { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Description : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the Description field in the assembly.
Docs.value: The Description field in the assembly.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information, see the documentation for the `/descr[iption]` option in [Al.exe (Assembly Linker)](/dotnet/framework/tools/al-exe-assembly-linker).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property cli::array <Microsoft::Build::Framework::ITaskItem ^> ^ EmbedResources { cli::array <Microsoft::Build::Framework::ITaskItem ^> ^ get(); void set(cli::array <Microsoft::Build::Framework::ITaskItem ^> ^ value); };
member this.EmbedResources : Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the resources to embed in the image that contains the assembly manifest.
Docs.value: The resources to embed in the image that contains the assembly manifest.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This task copies the contents of the resource file into the image. The items set in this property may have optional metadata attached to them called `LogicalName` and `Access`. The `LogicalName` metadata is used to specify the internal identifier for the resource. The `Access` metadata can be set to `private` in order to make the resource not visible to other assemblies. For more information, see the documentation for the `/embed[resource]` option in [Al.exe (Assembly Linker)](/dotnet/framework/tools/al-exe-assembly-linker).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ EvidenceFile { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.EvidenceFile : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the file to embed in the assembly with the resource name of Security.Evidence.
Docs.value: The file to embed in the assembly with the resource name of Security.Evidence.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You cannot use `Security.Evidence` for regular resources. This property corresponds to the `/e[vidence]` option in [Al.exe (Assembly Linker)](/dotnet/framework/tools/al-exe-assembly-linker).

member this.GenerateFullPaths : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether to cause the task to use the absolute path for any files that are reported in an error message.
Docs.value: if the task will use the absolute path for any files that are reported in an error message; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property corresponds to the `/fullpaths` option in [Al.exe (Assembly Linker)](/dotnet/framework/tools/al-exe-assembly-linker).

Protected Overrides Function GenerateFullPathToTool () As String

Docs.summary: Returns the full file path to the AL tool.
Docs.returns: The full file path to the AL tool.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ KeyContainer { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.KeyContainer : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a container that holds a key pair.
Docs.value: The container that holds a key pair.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This will sign the assembly (give it a strong name) by inserting a public key into the assembly manifest. The task will then sign the final assembly with the private key. For more information, see the documentation for the `/keyn[ame]` option in [Al.exe (Assembly Linker)](/dotnet/framework/tools/al-exe-assembly-linker).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ KeyFile { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.KeyFile : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a file that contains a key pair or just a public key to sign an assembly.
Docs.value: The file that contains a key pair or just a public key to sign an assembly.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The compiler inserts the public key in the assembly manifest and then signs the final assembly with the private key. For more information, see the documentation for the `/keyf[ile]` option in [Al.exe (Assembly Linker)](/dotnet/framework/tools/al-exe-assembly-linker).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property cli::array <Microsoft::Build::Framework::ITaskItem ^> ^ LinkResources { cli::array <Microsoft::Build::Framework::ITaskItem ^> ^ get(); void set(cli::array <Microsoft::Build::Framework::ITaskItem ^> ^ value); };
member this.LinkResources : Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the resource files to link to an assembly.
Docs.value: The resource files to link to an assembly.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The resource becomes part of the assembly, but the file is not copied. The items passed in to this parameter may have optional metadata attached to them called `LogicalName`, `Target`, and `Access`. The `LogicalName` metadata is used to specify the internal identifier for the resource. The `Target` metadata can specify the path and filename to which the task copies the file, after which it compiles this new file into the assembly. The `Access` metadata can be set to `private` in order to make the resource not visible to other assemblies. For more information, see the documentation for the `/link[resource]` option in [Al.exe (Assembly Linker)](/dotnet/framework/tools/al-exe-assembly-linker).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ MainEntryPoint { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.MainEntryPoint : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the fully qualified name (*class.method*) of the method to use as an entry point when converting a module to an executable file.
Docs.value: The fully qualified name (*class.method*) of the method to use as an entry point when converting a module to an executable file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property corresponds to the `/main` option in [Al.exe (Assembly Linker)](/dotnet/framework/tools/al-exe-assembly-linker).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Build::Framework::ITaskItem ^ OutputAssembly { Microsoft::Build::Framework::ITaskItem ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::Build::Framework::ITaskItem ^ value); };
member this.OutputAssembly : Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the file generated by this task.
Docs.value: The name of the file generated by this task.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property corresponds to the `/out` option in [Al.exe (Assembly Linker)](/dotnet/framework/tools/al-exe-assembly-linker).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Platform { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Platform : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a string that limits which platform this code can run on; must be one of x86, Itanium, x64, or anycpu.
Docs.value: A string that limits which platform this code can run on; must be one of x86, Itanium, x64, or anycpu.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default is `anycpu`. This property corresponds to the `/platform` option in [Al.exe (Assembly Linker)](/dotnet/framework/tools/al-exe-assembly-linker).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool Prefer32Bit { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.Prefer32Bit : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the task runs on a 32-bit platform.
Docs.value: if the task runs on a 32-bit platform; otherwise, .

member this.ProductName : string with get, set

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information, see the documentation for the `/prod[uct]` option in [Al.exe (Assembly Linker)](/dotnet/framework/tools/al-exe-assembly-linker).

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information, see the documentation for the `/productv[ersion]` option in [Al.exe (Assembly Linker)](/dotnet/framework/tools/al-exe-assembly-linker).

member this.ResponseFiles : string[] with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the names of the response files that contain commands for the AL tool.
Docs.value: The names of the response files that contain commands for the AL tool.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ SdkToolsPath { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.SdkToolsPath : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the path to the SDK tools.
Docs.value: The path to the SDK tools.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property cli::array <Microsoft::Build::Framework::ITaskItem ^> ^ SourceModules { cli::array <Microsoft::Build::Framework::ITaskItem ^> ^ get(); void set(cli::array <Microsoft::Build::Framework::ITaskItem ^> ^ value); };
member this.SourceModules : Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the modules to be compiled into an assembly.
Docs.value: The modules to be compiled into an assembly.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The modules will be listed in the manifest of the resulting assembly, and will still need to distributed and available in order for the assembly to load. The items passed into this parameter may have additional metadata called `Target`, which specifies the path and filename to which the task copies the file, after which it compiles this new file into the assembly. For more information, see the documentation for [Al.exe (Assembly Linker)](/dotnet/framework/tools/al-exe-assembly-linker). This property corresponds to the list of modules passed into Al.exe without a specific switch.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ TargetType { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.TargetType : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the file format of the output file: library (code library), exe (console application), or win (Windows-based application).
Docs.value: The file format of the output file: library (code library), exe (console application), or win (Windows-based application).

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default is `library`. This property corresponds to the `/t[arget]` option in [Al.exe (Assembly Linker)](/dotnet/framework/tools/al-exe-assembly-linker).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ TemplateFile { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.TemplateFile : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the assembly from which to inherit all assembly metadata, except the culture field.
Docs.value: The assembly from which to inherit all assembly metadata, except the culture field.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The specified assembly must have a strong name. An assembly that you create with the `TemplateFile` parameter will be a satellite assembly. This property corresponds to the `/template` option in [Al.exe (Assembly Linker)](/dotnet/framework/tools/al-exe-assembly-linker).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Title { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Title : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the Title field in the assembly.
Docs.value: The Title field in the assembly.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information, see the documentation for the `/title` option in [Al.exe (Assembly Linker)](/dotnet/framework/tools/al-exe-assembly-linker).

protected: virtual property System::String ^ ToolName { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the tool (Al.exe).
Docs.value: The name of the tool.

member this.Trademark : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the Trademark field in the assembly.
Docs.value: The Trademark field in the assembly.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information, see the documentation for the `/trade[mark]` option in [Al.exe (Assembly Linker)](/dotnet/framework/tools/al-exe-assembly-linker).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Version { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Version : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the version information for this assembly.
Docs.value: The version information for this assembly.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The format of the string is *major.minor.build.revision*. The default value is 0. For more information, see the documentation for the `/v[ersion]` option in [Al.exe (Assembly Linker)](/dotnet/framework/tools/al-exe-assembly-linker).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Win32Icon { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Win32Icon : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the .ico file to insert in the assembly.
Docs.value: The .ico file to insert in the assembly.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The .ico file gives the output file the desired appearance in Windows Explorer. This property corresponds to the `/win32icon` option in [Al.exe (Assembly Linker)](/dotnet/framework/tools/al-exe-assembly-linker).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Win32Resource { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Win32Resource : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a Win32 resource (.res file) to insert in the output file.
Docs.value: The Win32 resource (.res file) to insert in the output file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information, see the documentation for the `/win32res` option in [Al.exe (Assembly Linker)](/dotnet/framework/tools/al-exe-assembly-linker).
